title: Something went wrong while attempting to connect to the network [Ganache]
body:
- [ ] I've asked for help in the [Truffle Gitter](http://gitter.im/Consensys/truffle) before filing this issue.

---------------------------

## Issue

I am following this tutorial https://youtu.be/YPbgjPPC1d0 and I am stuck at 34:50
Everything worked fine, but when I write `truffle test` I get this error:

```
> Something went wrong while attempting to connect to the network. Check your network configuration.

Could not connect to your Ethereum client with the following parameters:
    - host       > 127.0.0.1
    - port       > 7545
    - network_id > 5777
Please check that your Ethereum client:
    - is running
    - is accepting RPC connections (i.e., "--rpc" or "--http" option is used in geth)   
    - is accessible over the network
    - is properly configured in your Truffle configuration file (truffle-config.js)     

Truffle v5.4.6 (core: 5.4.6)
Node v10.19.0


```
I followed tutorial closely and understand where to find host,port,network_id on ganache, but somehow I can't connect with it. 
When I used `truffle migrate` the connection was good and was able to execute that command
## Steps to Reproduce

My truffle-config.js code is:
```
require('babel-register');
require('babel-polyfill');

module.exports = {
  networks: {
    development: {
      host: "127.0.0.1",
      port: 7545,
      network_id: "5777" // Match any network id
    },
  },
  contracts_directory: './src/contracts/',
  contracts_build_directory: './src/abis/',
  compilers: {
    solc: {
      optimizer: {
        enabled: true,
        runs: 200
      }
    }
  }
}

```
Also followed whole tutorial up to 34:50 ( https://youtu.be/YPbgjPPC1d0 )
## Expected Behavior

Connection to ganache

## Actual Results

```
Could not connect to your Ethereum client with the following parameters:
    - host       > 127.0.0.1
    - port       > 7545
    - network_id > 5777
Please check that your Ethereum client:
    - is running
    - is accepting RPC connections (i.e., "--rpc" or "--http" option is used in geth)   
    - is accessible over the network
    - is properly configured in your Truffle configuration file (truffle-config.js)     

Truffle v5.4.6 (core: 5.4.6)
Node v10.19.0

```

## Environment

* Operating System: Windows
* Ethereum client: Ganache
* Truffle version (`truffle version`): v5.4.6
* node version (`node --version`): v10.19.0
* npm version (`npm --version`): 6.14.4
* Visual Studio Code
Changing the network to vEthernet (WSL) on Ganache did the trick. Note address will change every restart
